title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 1 point:

ϕ m = ∫ B ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct answer

ϕ m = B 0 L h 0
descriptions:
The response earns none of the following point:

ϕ m = ∫ B ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct answer

ϕ m = B 0 L h 0

The response the following point:

ϕ m = ∫ B ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct answer

ϕ m = B 0 L h 0

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

1 point: For a correct direction arrow

1 point: For a valid justification using Lenz’s Law or the right-hand rule, if the direction is also correct

Examples:

  • The flux is decreasing as the area is decreasing, and a current to the right would cause an inward magnetic field that would increase flux.

  • The force on the falling positive charge carriers is to the right, which causes a conventional current to the right.

  • The force on the falling positive charge carriers is to the right, which causes a conventional current to the right.

The response earns both of the following points:

1 point: For a valid justification using Lenz’s Law or the right-hand rule, if the direction is also correct

Examples:

  • The flux is decreasing as the area is decreasing, and a current to the right would cause an inward magnetic field that would increase flux.

  • The force on the falling positive charge carriers is to the right, which causes a conventional current to the right.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For a correct relationship between current, voltage, and resistance

I = E R

1 point: For a correct relationship between the induced emf and the magnetic field

| E | = d ϕ m d t

| E | = B 0 L d h d t

| E | = B 0 L v

1 point: For a correct answer #

I = B 0 L v / R

Note: If only the correct answer is given, with no accompanying work, only 1 point can be awarded.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 4 points:

For a correct net force equation showing opposite directions for the gravitational and magnetic forces, Fg and FM

∑ F = m a = F g − F M = m g − F M

a = g − F M m

For using an appropriate equation to find FM

F M = ∫ I | d ℓ × B | = I L B 0

For substituting the current from part (c)

F M = ⟮ B 0 L v R ⟯ L B 0 = B 0 2 L 2 v R

For expressing acceleration a as dv/dt

dv dt =g− B 0 2 L 2 v mR MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44AF@

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

1 point: For setting the gravitational force equal to the magnetic force

a = 0; therefore FM = Fg

1 point: For correct substitution of expressions for the forces

m g = I L B 0 = B 0 2 L 2 v t / R

v T = m g R B 0 2 L 2

Note: If the correct expression for vT is stated without support, 2 points are awarded.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For correctly checking “Increases”

Note: If an incorrect choice is made for the change in terminal speed, the justification points cannot be earned.

1 point: For indicating the inverse relationship between resistance and current

1 point: For indicating that a smaller current produces a smaller magnetic force on the bar,leading to the conclusion that to achieve a magnetic force equal to the bar’s weight,the bar must be moving faster to produce the necessary current in the bar.

Note: If the only justification is stating that vT α R from the equation for in part (e), only 1 justification point is awarded, because the question specifically asks for the answer in terms of forces on the crossbar.
